message_1: Consider an encrypted message using the Caesar Cipher, where each letter of the message is shifted three letters to the right in the alphabet. The encrypted message is "EB FNENU". Determine the original message before it was encrypted.
message_2:
To decrypt the message, we need to shift each letter three positions to the left in the alphabet. 

The encrypted message is "EB FNENU". 

E -> B (shifted 3 positions to the left)
B -> Y (shifted 3 positions to the left)
F -> C (shifted 3 positions to the left)
N -> K (shifted 3 positions to the left)
E -> B (shifted 3 positions to the left)
N -> K (shifted 3 positions to the left)
U -> R (shifted 3 positions to the left)

The original message before it was encrypted is "BY CKBR".
